item.title: After 40 years of plot twists and drama, Neighbours wraps up for the last time — again

item.title: Donald Trump says land strikes on Venezuela drug shipments coming soon

item.title: Record-breaking crocodile Cassius taxidermied for Green Island exhibit
item.description: The world's largest crocodile in captivity until its death last year is going on display in Far North Queensland, as more findings are revealed about its cause of death.

item.description: WA's planning authorities approve the construction of two new ferry terminals at Applecross and Matilda Bay as part of the state government's expansion of Swan River ferry services.

item.description: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

item.description: A Victorian Parliamentary Inquiry report finds youth career support is "severely lacking" as students fear AI is threatening white-collar industries.

item.title: Treasurer Jim Chalmers gives green light to Hanwha's double stake in shipbuilder Austal
item.description: Jim Chalmers said there will be "strict conditions" on the South Korean defence conglomerate's stake in the strategic shipbuilder, in a nod to the diplomatic and security sensitivities surrounding the bid.

item.description: The biggest night in gaming is getting underway in the heart of downtown Los Angeles.

item.title: Hollywood director Carl Rinsch convicted of scamming Netflix out of $16.5m
item.description: Carl Erik Rinsch is convicted on charges that he scammed Netflix out of $US11 million for a show that never materialised, instead using the cash for purchases including luxury cars and homewares.

item.title: Perth fires prompt warning of extreme conditions as Kenwick, Bullsbrook blazes downgraded
item.description: A Kenwick resident who lost a shed and thousands of dollars worth of machinery in a bushfire in Perth's south-east says the blaze came within metres of her house.

item.description: South Australia's new Liberal leader Ashton Hurn unveils a "streamlined" shadow cabinet, just 99 days out from the next state election.

item.description: A Queensland high school has re-engaged students by embedding agriculture into the curriculum and building strong local industry ties.

item.description: Sports and Communications Minister Anika Wells referred her claims to the Independent Parliamentary Expenses Authority for review after a stream of questions over her spending earlier this week.

item.description: They are an eclectic mix but this diverse fleet of helicopters, water bombers and planes is ready to protect south-eastern Australia.

item.description: Australia are among the countries with the most ticket requests for next year's World Cup, which is bound to please Socceroos coach Tony Popovic and his team.

item.description: Every year about 1.5 million Australians travel to Bali. Chances are either you or someone you know has caught a stomach bug after travelling to the popular Indonesian destination. So what can you do to avoid it?

item.description: PhD students from Curtin University have found a 300-gram meteorite after a five-day search in remote bushland.

item.description: Perth is in the grip of its hottest spell so far this summer, forcing the closure of a popular tourist attraction as abalone fishing season got underway.

item.description: Manila's coastguard says nearly two dozen Philippine fishing boats near Sabina Shoal were targeted with water cannon and blocking manoeuvres on Friday.

item.title: How Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial became a struggle for Israel itself

item.description: Two US service members and one American civilian are killed in an ambush in central Syria.

item.description: It has been a busy year for search and rescue operations in the Tasmanian high country. Authorities say a concerning number of visitors to the state's famous national parks are ill-prepared for the fickle weather — even during summer.

item.description: Adelaide sits on the most active seismic zone in Australia and has more than its fair share of tremors below magnitude-4, but it's been 71 years since it was rocked by a serious earthquake. Now, it's a matter of when, not if, it gets another one.

item.description: Kanyanyapilla means "place of many eagles", and it's where Indigenous students in Adelaide are coming to connect with Kaurna culture.

item.description: Australia's domestic intelligence agency, ASIO, examined one of the Bondi Beach gunmen six years ago for his close ties to a Sydney-based Islamic State terrorism cell, the ABC understands.

item.title: City of Karratha applies for international airport status
item.description: The City of Karratha has applied to the federal government for international airport status in a move that has been welcomed by residents.

item.title: Kendrick Lamar delights young fan with birthday song at Canberra Spilt Milk festival
item.description: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

item.title: England warned Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks ahead of third Ashes Test
item.description: With England pinning its hopes on victory in the third Test, the tourists have been warned that the Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong, Death Stranding 2 and Donkey Kong Bananza among our best games of 2025
item.description: There are games to suit everyone, and overwhelmingly Australians are a game-playing nation. Here are some of the most important titles released this year.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu lashes out at Anthony Albanese over Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: In a fiery address overnight, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said "antisemitism is a cancer" and that it "spreads when leaders stay silent".

item.title: Sussan Ley accuses Albanese of failing to keep Jewish Australians safe
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has allowed antisemitism to "fester" and failed to keep Jewish Australians safe in the wake of yesterday's "evil" terror attack on the shores of Bondi.

item.title: WA's wettest towns have had no local drinking water for 15 years
item.description: Quinninup and Northcliffe in Western Australia's south-west receive an average of 1 metre of rain every year, so why has the state government spent millions of dollars trucking in drinking water?

item.title: Matildas star Sam Kerr impresses again for Chelsea in WSL after starting as sub
item.description: Matildas gun Sam Kerr starts on the bench again, but makes an immediate impact for Chelsea in a 3-0 WSL victory.

item.title: Jewish community leaders say 'things can't go back to normal' after deadly Bondi attack
item.description: The Australian Jewish community is in a state of shock following the Bondi shootings, with leaders calling for more to be done to combat anti-Semitism.

item.title: Kahu's been woodchopping his whole life, but a heart attack mid-competition almost killed him
item.description: Kahu Woolley was clinically dead multiple times, but quick actions by his friends brought him back.

item.title: Soren Copley in court over Philippines child sex abuse allegations
item.description: The Australian Federal Police says it launched an investigation into North Queensland man Soren Copley in September after a tip-off from US Homeland Security.

item.title: Dolphin Sands bushfire sparked by improperly extinguished burn off, Tasmanian authorities confirm
item.description: A bushfire in Tasmania that destroyed 19 homes was caused by a registered burn conducted about a week earlier, which was not extinguished by a landowner, authorities have confirmed.

item.title: Australians urged to give blood in wake of Bondi Beach mass shooting
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns urges community members wanting to help the Jewish community following the Bondi terror attack to donate blood.

item.title: Premier says Operation Shelter will be ‘inconvenient’ but necessary
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Parole release of Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis overturned
item.description: Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis will remain behind bars, after the South Australian Parole Board's decision to release him was overturned.

item.title: Anthony Albanese will face questions over Bondi Beach shooting as Australia mourns
item.description: Anthony Albanese's first responsibility after the horrific Bondi terror attack is to lead a grieving nation. His next will be to explain how this happened.

item.title: NFL quick hits: Patrick Mahomes tears his ACL, Micah Parsons suffers knee injury, Philip Rivers scores a touchdown
item.description: Patrick Mahomes tears his ACL, the Packers suffer a major blow, Donald Trump's coin toss goes viral and Old Man Rivers scores a touchdown. Here's the five quick hits from the NFL action.

item.title: Cameron Pearson admits murdering Perth lawyer Alice McShera at Crown Towers
item.description: A 44-year-old man admits killing Perth lawyer Alice McShera, whose body was found in a hotel room in the upmarket Crown Towers complex in 2023.

item.title: What videos tell us about the final moments of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: In the final horrific minutes of the Bondi Beach terror attack, more than 100 shots were fired. ABC NEWS Verify has analysed footage showing how the last six minutes unfolded.

item.title: Australian luger Alex Ferlazzo makes stunning recovery during run after falling off his sled
item.description: Australian luger Alex Ferlazzo pulls off a miracle recovery after falling off his sled halfway through a run.

item.title: Inquest to probe death of Allan John Houston at Saraji mine in 2018
item.description: The veteran miner died when the bulldozer he was operating rolled off an embankment into a pool of mud.

item.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai found guilty of sedition and collusion
item.description: Jimmy Lai, a former Hong Kong media mogul and one of the city's most outspoken critics of China, has been found guilty of sedition and collusion in a landmark national security case that has drawn international scrutiny.

item.title: Deaths of Rob Reiner and wife investigated as apparent homicide, LAPD says
item.description: Rob Reiner, known for directing When Harry Met Sally... and A Few Good Men, was found dead alongside his wife inside their Los Angeles home.

item.title: Man convicted of kidnapping 19yo Charlie Gander now eligible for parole
item.description: A judge says the offending of a man found guilty of kidnapping a Victorian 19-year-old, who was later murdered, was "spontaneous" and "born of panic".

item.title: Man who killed two people in Bowen Bridge crash sentenced to home detention and community service
item.description: A man who caused the death of an elderly couple while driving with methamphetamine in his blood is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service and four months of home detention.

item.title: Parents of man who wrestled gun from Bondi Beach shooter call son a 'hero'
item.description: The ABC has spoken to the parents of Ahmed Al Ahmed who was shot after he heroically wrestled and disarmed one of the Bondi Beach attackers.

item.title: WA government meets with Jewish leaders after Bondi beach terror attack, increased police patrols
item.description: WA Premier Roger Cook condemns the "cowardly and heinous" attack in Bondi, after meeting with Jewish leaders in Perth as police increase patrols.
